info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 7:03PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Stephens, Habersham and Rabun Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 703 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles east of Hiawassee to 10 miles southwest of Clayton to 3 miles east of Cleveland. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Toccoa, Clayton, Clarkesville, Demorest, Mount Airy, Mountain City, Tiger, Avalon, Dillard and Sky Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
